Among the most powerful yai are those who emulate the form of [storm giants](/Monsters.aspx?ID=225). Rather than lord over their giant-kin like most oni, though, water yai prefer to lurk alone in the world's oceans (or, much more rarely, large and remote freshwater lakes). When a water yai must interact with mortals beneath the waves, they prefer to do so while disguised as a storm giant. Water yai pursue the acquisition of material wealth and riches above all other interests, garbing themselves in richly colored, magically waterproofed kimonos and adorning their monstrous faces with all manner of jewelry. These yai can infuse their kimonos with eerie magical properties, and in combat, they can also fire bolts of electricity from their third eye. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 36 **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Water Yai](/Monsters.aspx?ID=749) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 191 2.0 **Perception** +32; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Jotun](/Languages.aspx?ID=8) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +30, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +29, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +33, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +32, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +32, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +29, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +33 **Str** +9 **Dex** +6 **Con** +6 **Int** +5 **Wis** +9 **Cha** +6 **Items** _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [longspear](/Weapons.aspx?ID=6)_ --- **AC** 40 **Fort** +27 **Ref** +29 **Will** +34 +1 status on all saves vs. magical **HP** 295 , regeneration 15 (deactivated by acid and fire) **Immunities** electricity **[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)**
**Shocking Douse** **Trigger** A creature within 100 feet casts a fire spell; **Effect** The water yai flourishes their kimono and attempts a Performance check to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the spell before it comes into effect. If the yai counters the spell, the triggering creature takes 9d6 electricity damage from electrified water that sprays from the kimono (DC 35 basic Reflex save). --- **Speed** 40 feet, fly 40 feet, swim 50 feet; [_water walk_](/Spells.aspx?ID=371) **Melee** longspear +35 ([Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d8+15 piercing plus 2d6 electricity **Melee** kimono +33 ([Electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d12+12 electricity plus Enveloping Kimono **Melee** fist +33 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d8+15 bludgeoning plus 2d6 electricity **Ranged** electric missile +30 ([Electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 3d12+12 electricity plus [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) for 1 round **Primal Innate Spells** DC 38 - **2nd** [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (at will, self only) - **4th** [Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34) (×3), [Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=59) - **5th** [Control Water](/Spells.aspx?ID=51) (at will) - **8th** [Hydraulic Torrent](/Spells.aspx?ID=155) - **9th** [Chain Lightning](/Spells.aspx?ID=33), [Horrid Wilting](/Spells.aspx?ID=152) - **Constant (9th)** [Water Walk](/Spells.aspx?ID=371) **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=8)** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The water yai takes on the appearance of a [storm giant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=225). This doesn't change their Speed or Strike attack and damage. The yai can also turn into a puddle of water, with the effects of [_gaseous form_](/Spells.aspx?ID=129) except they retain their land Speed, double their swim Speed, and can't fly. **Enveloping Kimono** ([Electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), [Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157), [Water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165)) **Requirements** The water yai's last action was a successful kimono Strike; **Effect** The water yai extends a portion of their kimono to attempt to envelop a creature within 15 feet. The water yai must attempt a Performance check against the creature's Reflex DC.
**Critical Success** The creature takes 20d6 electricity damage and is [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) until the end of its next turn.
**Success** As critical success, but only 10d6 electricity damage.
**Failure** The target takes 5d6 electricity damage but is not grabbed.
**Critical Failure** The target is unaffected.
name: Water Yai
